column4: Hey guys, I'm trying to get Ushare to work (streaming to my xbox360)  It runs fine, but the xbox times out when it tries to connect (it can see it, just can't connect).  I don't have iptables, and I've disabled ufw... any ideas what it could be?
/etc/init.d/iptables start
bash: /etc/init.d/iptables: No such file or directory\
so how do I change that to allow all (I'm within a network, so will be fine)?  And why don't I have an /etc/init.d/iptables?
would "ufw disable" do the trick? does ufw work by creating iptables rules for me? or are they two separate firewalls that both have to be disabled?
ufw is a front end to iptables
awesome great, so "ufw status" gives me "Firewall not loaded" should imply that I allow all connections, right?
yes
does the xbox see the ushare?
Sort of... if I wait 5 minutes or so it appears but doesn't let me connect... it disappears if I wait longer though
so it fades in and out.... which makes me not surprised that the connection times out
can you pastebin your ushare.conf?
Ya, configure file here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=983131
few moments
if ushare is running, can you tell me what following gives you:  ps aux | grep ushare

I get: dan       6984  0.0  0.0  64664  2820 pts/0    Sl+  11:50   0:00 ushare -t -w -x -f /etc/ushare.conf  I'm currently running it manually with those -t -w -x commands... also tried running at a service or manually with just -x, all have the same behavior
try adding the -r command
sorry, no
it was -x that i was saying, but nevermind

Thanks for trying.  Guess I won't be able to watch any today.  I'll just wait for a reply to my thread... Though there were 3 or 4 other posts of people with the same issue which never got any replies :-/
i saw that,  i'd check around on some xbox forums too
good luck
thanks :-D
